questions.text: A plumbing permit expires if work authorized by such permit is not commenced within _____.
As long as such repairs do not require the replacement or rearrangement of valves, pipes or fittings, a plumbing permit is not required _____.

options.text: when work is done by the owner
when the contract is less than $100.00

questions.text: The maximum units on a 2 inch horizontal waste line is _____.
The common vent pipe size for five domestic kitchen sinks is _____.
A refrigerator, not regularly classed as a plumbing fixture may discharge into a/an _____.
Per Table 702. 2(b), one fixture unit has a discharge capacity of _____.
Gas appliances connected to a piping system shall have an accessible, approved manual shutoff valve within _____ feet of the equipment it serves.
The size of the supply piping outlet for a gas appliance shall not be less than _____ inch.
Except for direct vent appliances, a through-the-wall mechanical draft venting system shall terminate at least _____ feet above any forced air inlet located within 10 feet.
A fixture trap is vented to _____.

options.text: prevent the loss of a trap seal by siphonage or back pressure
add to the cost of installation

questions.text: Except for plastic piping, water piping systems shall be permitted to be tested with a (an) _____.
A valve that has the highest friction loss to water flow is the _____.
Of those listed, gas piping shall be tested with _____.
ABS DWV pipe installed horizontally shall be supported at intervals not to exceed _____.
Three-inch horizontal drainage piping shall have a uniform slope of not less than _____.
In sizing gas piping, the length of the system is measured from the meter location to _____.

options.text: where the first branch takes off
the kitchen range, if located near the meter
the most remote outlet on the system
a wall heater, if located in a bathroom

questions.text: Where supplementary gas for standby use is connected downstream from a meter, a _____ shall be installed.
Indoor gas hose connectors shall be of minimum length and shall not exceed _____ feet.
Of those listed, which material may be installed underground as part of a drain, waste and vent system?
With some exceptions the upper terminal of each horizontal drainage pipe shall be provided with _____.
The maximum number of bathtubs allowed on a 2-inch vent is _____.
Six bathtubs and six showers require a common vent of not less than _____ inches.
Where necessary, to insert fittings in gas pipe that has been installed in a concealed location, of those listed the pipe shall be reconnected with _____.
A _____ is not a fitting approved for changes in direction of drainage flow.
Of those listed, waste and vent pipes may be tested with _____.
Fuel gas piping pressure tests shall not be less than _____.

options.text: 1 1/2 times the proposed maximum working pressure

questions.text: Type B gas vents shall terminate not less than _____ feet above the highest connected appliance draft hood or flue collar.
No _____ or urinal shall be installed on combination waste and vent systems.
Gas meters shall be located in _____ locations.
A water closet seat shall be sized for the _____.
The minimum size gas supply for a mobile home is _____.
A pressure regulator shall be installed when the static water pressure is exceeding _____.
Of those listed, an expansion tank is required when _____.

options.text: the water heater is in the basement
the building is four stories high

questions.text: A backwater valve is used _____.

options.text: to back water up the pipe
to protect the system from back-siphonage
to prevent backflow of sewage in a drainage system

questions.text: All devices or assemblies installed in a potable water supply for protection against backflow shall be maintained in good working condition by _____.

options.text: the person having control of such devices

questions.text: Of those listed, the approved fitting for connecting a horizontal drain line with a horizontal drain line would be a _____.
The maximum full pipe flow in gpm for a hydromechanical grease interceptor with a 60 gpm rating requires _____ gpm size of grease interceptor for a 2 minute drainage period.
After allowing for friction and other pressure losses, the residual water pressure shall be of not less than _____ psi.
Gas meters shall not be placed where they will be subjected to damage such as: _____.
The maximum fixture units on a 4 inch drainage stack are _____.
Corrugated vent connectors shall _____.

options.text: not be smaller than the listed appliance categorized vent diameter
be sized as one-half the flue collar diameter
be larger than the draft hood outlet diameter

questions.text: The minimum dimension for an outdoor combustion air opening for a water heater shall not be less than _____ inches.
The developed length of 1-1/2 inch trap arms shall not exceed _____.
Of those listed, valves used to control 2 or more openings for water distribution shall be _____.
A sewage eject or receiving the discharge of water closets or urinals shall have a discharge capacity of not less than _____ gallons per minute.
Using Appendix A, the pressure at the base of a column of water 10 feet high is approximately psi.
The vent pipe serving a combination waste and vent system with a 4-inch drain pipe shall be at least _____ inches.
A 2-inch horizontal copper-tubing cold water line shall be supported at intervals of _____ feet.
The maximum length of an indirect waste pipe without a vent is less than _____ feet.
Traps are required for indirect waste pipes where the length exceeds _____ feet.
The maximum temperature of any water discharging under pressure directly into any part of a plumbing or drainage system is _____.
The maximum distance allowed for a 2-inch trap arm is _____.
The developed length between a trap of a water closet and its vent shall not exceed _____ feet.
Fixture traps shall have a liquid seal of not less than _____ inch(es).
Which of the following materials is prohibited by code for drainage and vent piping below ground?
Ofthoselisted, a watertight pan of corrosion resistant material is required when a water heater is located in a (an) _____.
Where joints are permitted for copper water tubing under a building slab, they shall be brazed and fittings shall be _____.
The minimum distance between the center of a water closet and a finished side wall or partition is _____ inches.
The finished dam or threshold for a shower, excluding accessibility requirements, shall not be less than _____ inch(es).

All shower compartments regardless of shape,excluding accessibility requirements and shower receptors having an overall dimension of not less than 30 inches in width and 60 inches in length, shall be capable of encompassing a minimum _____ inch circle.
The minimum size septic tank for a three-bedroom residence is _____ gallons.
A seepage pit shall have a minimum side wall (not including the arch) of _____.
Flexible water connectors shall be installed in _____.
The maximum trap loading for a 2 inch trap is _____.
The minimum size trap for a shower with a single head
No indirect waste pipe need be larger in diameter than the _____.

options.text: trap to which it is connected
size required to drain the fixture in one minute
drain outlet or tailpiece of the fixture

questions.text: Food preparation sinks shall be indirectly connected to the drainage system by means of a (an) _____.
The minimum size trap for a public (commercial) bar sink is _____.
Seepage pits shall be circular and have an excavated diameter of not less than _____.
No plumbing system or portion there of shall be covered, concealed or put into use until it is inspected and approved by the _____.
A permit is not required for _____.
Waste outlets and fixture tailpieces for kitchen sinks, laundry sinks, and bathtubs shall not be less than _____.
The total length of a 1-1/2-inch minimum sized vent pipe that may be installed horizontally is _____ feet.
Vent pipes may offset horizontally when the distance above the overflow level of the fixture is not less than _____.
Each vent pipe or stack shall extend through its flashings and shall terminate vertically not less than _____ inches above the roof.
A factor for determining loss in static pressure from the meter to the highest outlet is _____.

The minimum size gas pipe supplying a domestic freestanding gas range using natural gas with a pressure drop of 0. 5 inches water column, located 60 feet from the meter (1,100 Btu per cubic foot) is _____ inch.
Closet bends must be cut off so as to present a _____.

options.text: smooth surface even with the top of the closet ring
smooth surface even with the floor surface
surface that can be sealed with putty

questions.text: Leaks in gas piping shall be located by applying _____.

options.text: fire or acid to the exterior of the piping
ether to the interior of the piping
smoke to the interior of the piping

questions.text: Caulked joints shall be filled with molten lead to a depth of at least _____ inch(es).
The cleanout fitting for a 4-inch diameter drain pipe shall not be smaller than _____ inches.
A floor drain normally requires a 2-inch trap and a 2-inch waste line. In a combination waste and vent system, the size of the trap and waste line shall be at least _____ inches.
Fuel-burning water heaters shall be ensured an adequate supply of _____.
Fuel-burning water heaters may be installed in a closet located in the bedroom provided the closet is equipped with a _____.
An attic in which a water heater is installed shall be accessible through an opening of not less than.
Approved drawn-copper alloy tubing traps may be used on fixtures discharging _____.
Standpipe receptors for clothes washers shall extend above the trap not less than _____ inches.
A horizontal drainage line connecting with other horizontal drainage lines shall enter through _____.
Where approved by the Authority Having Jurisdiction, sewer piping 8 inches and larger may slope_____.
After connecting a building to the public sewer, abandoned private sewage disposal facilities shall be backfilled within _____ days.
PEX tubing shall not be installed within the first _____ inches of piping connected to a water heater.
Pressure-relief valves located inside buildings shall be provided with full-size discharge piping that shall extend _____.

options.text: through an air break to a plumbing fixture
by direct connection to a fixture tailpiece

questions.text: The valve installed on the cold water supply pipe to each water heater shall be _____.
Of those listed, the discharge line from a sewage ejector shall be provided with _____.

options.text: an air relief and siphon breaker
a backwater valve and gate valve

questions.text: Standard trap seals are required to be no less than/nor more than _____.
Copper tubing and fittings shall be permitted to be used with DWV systems except for _____ wastes.
A room has dimensions of 24 feet x 24 feet x 9 feet. Using the Standard Method for calculating combustion air, this space can support a maximum water heater input rating of how many Btu/h?
A rainwater catchment system is designed with an underground storage tank. The tank shall be _____.

options.text: capable of supporting a hydrostatic load of 60 psf
